content.class: bg-slate-100 rounded p-3 my-2 max-w-3xl mx-auto border-4 border-sky-900 rounded-lg

content.text:
En la sección de preguntas difíciles, se requiere un conocimiento mucho más complejo del uso del lenguaje, comprensión lectora y de análisis que va más allá del entendimiento de palabras y tiempos verbales simples y compuestos. En este caso, es necesario recordar claramente y entender los distintos tiempos verbales, así como el correcto uso de conectores, verbos modales (o verbos auxiliares) y condicionales para ser capaz de identificar errores en oraciones y textos.
Esto aplica en todas las preguntas de desarrollo avanzado o difícil, donde el alumno ya sabe identificar qué es lo que gramaticalmente completa mejor una idea y cómo esa idea podría verse con una redacción distinta.
En algunos casos se utilizará la comprensión de idea general y en otros tantos la información de palabras claves y la habilidad de “leer con detalle”.

content.textual:
Which is the correct sentence?
Rosie will be driving to Mexico City tomorrow.
Rosie will driving to Mexico City tomorrow.
Rosie be driving to Mexico City tomorrow. 
Rosie would have been driving to Mexico City tomorrow.
A

Which is the correct sentence?
Harry has been driven diverse types of cars.
Harry had driven diverse types of cars.
Harry had driving diverse types of cars.
Harry driven had diverse types of cars.
B

Which is the correct sentence?
Alana use to go home every weekend when she was studying college.
Alana was going home every weekend when she was a student college.
Alana went home every weekend when she has studied college.
Alana used to go home every weekend when she was studying college.
D

Which is the correct sentence?
Alexander did use to eating beef more often than he did sea food.
Alexander used to ate beef more often than he did sea food.
Alexander got used to eating beef more often than he did sea food.
Alexander got use to eating beef more often than he did sea food.
C

If she… it was your birthday, she………you a present.
hadn’t known, would have given
had known, would have given
knew, will given
has known, would have given
B

If I …. closer to my job, I…….more often.
live, walk
would live, would walk
had lived, will walk
lived, would walk
D

If you ….something, it ……….good.
overcooking, it does not taste
overcook, it does not taste
overcooked, it did not tasted
did overcook, it do not taste
B

He….the flight if he…..
wouldn’t have missed, hand’t overslept
wouldn’t have miss, hand’t overslept
would have missed, hand’t overslept
should have missed, had overslept
A

content.textual:
*Malcom is gifted.\nMalcom is in a special class.\nMalcom is studying advanced Math and Science.\nMalcom has two brothers.
-
Malcom studies Math in a special class with his two brothers. 
A gifted, special class, advanced Math is Malcom.
In a special class, Math and Science two brothers and Malcom.
Malcom is in a special class, studying Math and Science since he is gifted. He’s got two brothers.
D

* Helen is tall.\nHelen is beautiful.\nHelen is young.\nHelen models.
-
Helen is tall and beautiful and young and model.
Helen, who’s tall, beautiful and young, models.
Tall, beautiful, young, model Helen is.
Helen is young, model, taller and more beautiful.
B

*The cadets fight wars.\nThe cadets are strong.\nThe cadets are sometimes in danger.\nThe cadets are brave.
-
The cadets, who are strong and brave are sometimes in danger. They fight wars.
They fight wars who are strong and brave are sometimes in danger. 
Are strong and brave are sometimes in danger, fight wars the cadets.
The cadets are strong and brave are sometimes in danger and fight wars.
A

*  Susan loves children.\nSusan is an educator.\nSusan plays fun games.\nSusan knows her students.
-
Is an educator who knows her students and plays fun games, she loves children more Susan.
In addition, she loves children, she’s an educator, she plays fun games however she plays fun games.
Susan are educator, plays fun games. She loves children.
Susan is an educator who knows her students and plays fun games. In addition, she loves children.
D


*Dr. Harrison studied Medicine.\nDr. Harrison takes care of his patients.\nDr.Harrison is careful.\nDr.Harrison works hard.
-
Studied Medicine. Dr.Harrison He works hard, takes care of his patients and is careful.
Studied Medicine Dr.Harrison. He works hard, takes care of his patients and is careful.
Dr.Harrison studied Medicine. He works hard, takes care of his patients and is careful.
Studied, works hard, takes care, is careful, Dr.Harrison.
C

*Cynthia is creative.\nCynthia has always loved social media.\nCynthia started a business.\nCynthia is an entrepreneur. 
-
Cynthia has always loved social media and business.
Is a creative Cynthia entrepreneur who started a business about social media.
Cynthia, creative, interested, started, entrepreneur.
Cynthia is a creative entrepreneur who started a business about social media.
D

content.class: bg-slate-100 rounded p-3 my-2 max-w-3xl mx-auto

content.text: (1)Talking about education, people get to feel a little annoyed. (2) But, why is that? Well, first of all, Education has not evolved at the same speed as technology has. (3)Another important matter to be mentioned is the fact that a big percentage of educators do not feel comfortable nor convinced of adding technology to their daily routines. (4) This, of course, has been a problem for the real preparation constantly learners get during their school hours. (5) It is not that effective to be close to a good teacher that seems to be ‘against technology’ somehow. (6) Awareness needs to be created among the participants of the school system, so they realize what skills (soft and hard) students will need in the near future.
content.name: DI0B

content.textual:
Which word would be the most appropriate to start sentence 1?
As a result
When
As a consequence
Consequently 
B

Select the sentence that may complete better the ideas between sentences 1 and 2.
Education will continue being hard.
Are there good reasons for this?
Education is filled with controversy. 
Not really angry nor sad, but more just like tired.
D

Which of the following is INCORRECTLY used?
The word  “annoyed” in sentence 1.
The word “evolved” in sentence 2.
The word “percentage” in sentence 3.
The word “constantly” in sentence 4.
D

Select the sentence that is in passive voice.
Awareness needs to be created among the participants of the school system.
They realize what skills (soft and hard) students will need in the near future.
It is not that effective to be close to a good teacher that seems to be ‘against technology’ somehow.
But, why is that?
A
